column4: I just installed the latest updates, rebooted, and now 10 seconds after logging in I can no longer access any active elements of Gnome
Can't move windows around, click on menus, anything
This is a terminal window I opened before the gui freeze.
try ctrl+alt+f1, then ctrl+alt+f7 to switch to a console and back; some grabs can do that and if you're lucky it'll break it
if you can't switch than that's interesting indeed
I can switch, it just doesn't help
can you login on the terminal and do DISPLAY=:0 xlsclients
This time, the GUI started working again, about 20 seconds after it froze. Still nothing on /var/log/messages
and xlsclients, it shows everything connected and the culprit is somewhere in there
That log provided some interesting googling fodder; thanks.  xlsclients is a good list to have, too
Looks like it may very well be flash killing my system. I've put out an open contract on all Adobe VPs, as part of my bugfix attempt
nice, are you using nspluginwrapper or an nvidia card?
nspluginwrapper--but my card is a gefore 9800 GT.  Dunno why Ubuntu chose nspluginwrapper
well because theres no nonbeta flash plugin, you can purge flashplugin-installer and install the plugin manually
if you're not running the 64bit edition then it's not nspluginwrapper
yea so uninstall flash from the package manager and get the .so for 64bit flash from adobe, stash it in ~/.mozilla/plugins
